item.title: Parking on corners blocking cars, 10th December
item.description:
This is a reoccurring issue in this area which results in corners being blocked and cars not being able to be moved. The corners here need to be double yellow lines.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenhaven Drive, Thamesmead

item.title: Dumped wardrobe outside my house, 10th December
item.description:
Today I noticed someone had dumped a broken wardrobe outside my house at 48 froissart road. It is on the pavement meaning it is awkward to walk past and could fall on some one. It is also an eyesore.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Keynsham Gardens, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole 50mm deep 3m X 1m, 10th December
item.description:
Another pothole in Sandhurst Road outside number 27. B13 bus route. The whole of this road surface from No.4 to No. 27 is breaking up badly. Cars are swerving and zig zagging to avoid multiple potholes over a 50m section of road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandhurst Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: FixMyStreet Ref : 8111528, 10th December
item.description:
Despite reporting this on numerous occasions and being informed by FixMyStreet that it has been fixed, it has NOT been fixed and has NEVER been fixed! Entrance to East Wickham Open Space, Highbanks Close, DA163ES

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highbanks Close, East Wickham, Greater London

item.title: Pothole 75mm deep 0.5m X 0.5m, 10th December
item.description:
Another deep pothole in Sandhurst Road. Outside 4 Sandhurst Road. B13 bus route. The whole road surface from 4 Sandhurst Road to 27 Sandhurst Road is breaking up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandhurst Road, Blendon, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipping restricting access for disabled property, 10th December
item.description:
Constant fly tipping blocking access to parking space for disabled person and blocking rear access to ALL disabled properties and exit incase of fire. Needs to be rectified as soon as possible we are going to take all measures to ensure this doesn't happen again or the perpetrators are caught by using i.e CCTV and guard rails/chains to stop them reverse parking, dumping and speeding off. It's causing so many problems and it is extremely dangerous under the wrong circumstances. Please help as a matter of urgency. Ant help greatly appreciated.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bracondale Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering by school children, 10th December
item.description:
The children from Beth’s school are dropping their fast food cartons at this point/junction as they return back to school. I have reported the problem to the school but it continues. Bins at the entrances to the school may encourage the children to do the right thing. can you suggest this as a solution to the school, and make them responsible for the emptying. Just an idea
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartford Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light out for months reported fix my street 28/10 reported again to office last week .. nothing has been done, 10th December
item.description:
Alley 34 is a mine field in the daylight . With one street light out it’s an accident. / robbery / assault waiting to happen . When are you going to bother to fix this problem???
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colyers Lane, North End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pooling of water poor drainage, 10th December
item.description:
This section of road was repaired a few years ago, along with the adjacent drain. Since then this annoying puddle always accumulates. Why are repairs not checked for quality after they are done, we should not have to pay for substandard repairs. Can this be fixed as it represents a problem for me 104 and my neighbour at 102 should we have a downpour as climate change predicts. Thanks for your attention and time Caryn Mortimer

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 87, Albert Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drug dealing, 10th December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bastion Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing / Full Bins, 10th December
item.description:
Not Been Emptied for over two weeks! General waste and dog poop bins full and some overflowing in East Wickham Open Space!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pinecroft, East Wickham, Greater London
